text: Ronald James Sider (September 17, 1939 – July 27, 2022) was a Canadian-born American theologian and social activist. He was the founder of Evangelicals for Social Action. He was also a founding board member of the National Religious Partnership for the Environment. He was a professor at Palmer Theological Seminary. Sider was born in Stevensville, Canada. Sider died on July 27, 2022 at his home in Wayne, Pennsylvania from a heart attack, aged 82.Ron Sider, evangelical activist who wrote ‘Rich Christians in an Age of Hunger,’ dies at 82 ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:Canadian activists Category:Writers from Ontario Category:Writers from Pennsylvania Category:Canadian academics Category:American theologians Category:American activists Category:Academics from Pennsylvania
